original: Majjhima Nikāya 78
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Samaṇamuṇḍikasutta
analyzed: samaṇa muṇḍika sutta
translated: With the Ascetic Muṇḍiya

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.🔽Tena kho pana samayena uggāhamāno paribbājako samaṇamuṇḍikāputto samayappavādake
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme  tena kho pana samayena uggāhamānaḥ paribbājakaḥ samaṇa muṇḍikā putto samaya ppavādake
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: tindukācīre ekasālake mallikāya ārāme paṭivasati mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṁ🔽pañcamattehi paribbājakasatehi.
analyzed: tindukācīre ekasālake mallikāya ārāme paṭivasati mahatiyā paribbājaka parisāya saddhi  pañcamattehi paribbājaka satehi
translated: Now at that time the wanderer Uggāhamāna, Muṇḍiya’s son, was staying in Mallikā’s Park, in the Tinduka Lodging, with a large assembly of wanderers.🔽He was a teacher of teachers, a famous and renowned religious founder, well-known and famous, with many disciples and a large assembly.

original: Atha kho pañcakaṅgo thapati sāvatthiyā nikkhami divā divassa bhagavantaṁ dassanāya.
analyzed: atha kho pañcakaṅgaḥ thapati sāvatthiyā nikkhami divā divassa bhagavantam dassanāya
translated: Then the householder Pañcakaṅga left Sāvatthī in the middle of the day to see the Buddha.

original: Atha kho pañcakaṅgassa thapatissa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho pañcakaṅgassa thapatissa etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to him:

original: “akālo kho tāva bhagavantaṁ dassanāya;
analyzed: akālaḥ kho tāva bhagavantam dassanāya
translated: “It’s the wrong time to see the Buddha,

original: paṭisallīno bhagavā.
analyzed: paṭisallīnaḥ bhagavā
translated: he’s in seclusion.

original: Manobhāvaniyānampi bhikkhūnaṁ asamayo dassanāya;
analyzed: manobhāva niyānam pi bhikkhūnam asamayaḥ dassanāya
translated: It’s the wrong time to see the monks who are mindfully present,

original: paṭisallīnā manobhāvaniyā bhikkhū.
analyzed: paṭisallīnāḥ manobhāvaniyāḥ bhikkhū
translated: they’re in seclusion.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ yena samayappavādako tindukācīro ekasālako mallikāya ārāmo yena uggāhamāno paribbājako samaṇamuṇḍikāputto tenupasaṅkameyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham yena samaya pavādakaḥ tindukācīraḥ eka sālakaḥ mallikāyaḥ ārāmaḥ yena uggāhamānaḥ paribbājakaḥ samaṇamuṇḍikāputto tena upasaṅkameyyanti
translated: Why don’t I go to the debate hall of the Acacia Grove, to the wandering mendicant Uggahamana, the son of Muṇḍiya?”

original: Atha kho pañcakaṅgo thapati yena samayappavādako tindukācīro ekasālako mallikāya ārāmo yena uggāhamāno paribbājako samaṇamuṇḍikāputto tenupasaṅkami.🔽Tena kho pana samayena uggāhamāno paribbājako samaṇamuṇḍikāputto mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya
analyzed: atha kho pañcakaṅgaḥ thapati yena samaya pavādakaḥ tindukācīraḥ eka sālakaḥ mallikāya ārāmaḥ yena uggāhamānaḥ paribbājakaḥ samaṇamuṇḍikāputto tena upasaṅkami  tena kho pana samayena uggāhamānaḥ paribbājakaḥ samaṇa muṇḍikā puttaḥ mahatiyā paribbājaka parisāya
translated: Then the householder Pañcakaṅga went to the debate hall of the Acacia Grove, to the wandering mendicant Uggahamana, the son of Muṇḍiya.

original: saddhiṁ nisinno hoti unnādiniyā uccāsaddamahāsaddāya anekavihitaṁ tiracchānakathaṁ🔽kathentiyā, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: saddhim nisinnaḥ hoti unnādiniyā uccāsadda mahāsaddāya aneka vihitam  kathentiyā
translated: At that time Uggahamana was seated with a large assembly of wanderers who were making an uproar, loudly and noisily talking many kinds of pointless talk,🔽such as talk about kings, …

original: rājakathaṁ corakathaṁ mahāmattakathaṁ senākathaṁ bhayakathaṁ yuddhakathaṁ annakathaṁ🔽pānakathaṁ vatthakathaṁ sayanakathaṁ mālākathaṁ gandhakathaṁ ñātikathaṁ yānakathaṁ
analyzed: rāja katham cora katham mahā matta katham senā katham bhaya katham yuddha katham anna katha 🔽pāna katham vattha katham sayana katham mālā katham gandha katham ñāti katham yāna katha
translated: and talk about being killed, beaten, wounded, or slain.

original: gāmakathaṁ nigamakathaṁ nagarakathaṁ janapadakathaṁ itthikathaṁ sūrakathaṁ visikhākathaṁ
analyzed: gāma katham nigama katham nagara katham janapada katham itthi katham sūra katham visikhā katha
translated: talk about villages, talk about towns, talk about cities, talk about the countryside, talk about women, talk about heroes, talk about the streets,

original: kumbhaṭṭhānakathaṁ pubbapetakathaṁ nānattakathaṁ lokakkhāyikaṁ samuddakkhāyikaṁ itibhavābhavakathaṁ iti vā.
analyzed: kumbhaṭṭhāna katham pubba peta katham nānatta katham loka khāyikam samudda khāyikam iti bhava abhava katham iti vā
translated: talk about well-known people, talk about the departed, talk about diversity, talk about the world, talk about the ocean, talk about becoming this or that.

original: Addasā kho uggāhamāno paribbājako samaṇamuṇḍikāputto pañcakaṅgaṁ thapatiṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho uggāhamānaḥ paribbājakaḥ samaṇamuṇḍikāputto pañcakaṅgam thapatim dūratas vā āgacchanta
translated: The wanderer Uggahamana saw the householder Pañcakaṅga coming in the distance.

original: Disvāna sakaṁ parisaṁ saṇṭhāpesi:
analyzed: disvāna sakam parisam saṇṭhāpesi
translated: Seeing him, he addressed his assembly,

original: “appasaddā bhonto hontu, mā bhonto saddamakattha;🔽ayaṁ samaṇassa gotamassa sāvako āgacchati pañcakaṅgo thapati.
analyzed: appasaddāḥ bhonto hontu mā bhonto saddam akattha  ayam samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakaḥ āgacchati pañcakaṅgo thapati
translated: “Be quiet, sirs, don’t make any noise.🔽Here comes the householder Pañcakaṅga, a disciple of the ascetic Gotama, a trainee disciple of the ascetic Gotama.

original: Yāvatā kho pana samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakā gihī odātavasanā sāvatthiyaṁ paṭivasanti ayaṁ tesaṁ aññataro pañcakaṅgo thapati.
analyzed: yāvatā kho pana samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakāḥ gihī odāta vasanā sāvatthiyam paṭivasanti ayam tesam aññataraḥ pañcakaṅgo thapati
translated: As far as the ascetic Gotama’s lay disciples in saffron robes living in Sāvatthī are concerned, he is one of them.

original: Appasaddakāmā kho pana te āyasmanto appasaddavinītā appasaddassa vaṇṇavādino;
analyzed: appasadda kāmāḥ kho pana te āyasmantaḥ appasadda vinītāḥ appasaddassa vaṇṇa vādino
translated: But these venerables like quiet, they are committed to quiet, they praise quiet,

original: appeva nāma appasaddaṁ parisaṁ viditvā upasaṅkamitabbaṁ maññeyyā”ti.
analyzed: appā iva nāma appa saddam parisam viditvā upasaṅkamitabbam maññeyya ati
translated: Perhaps he will think to approach a group that is quiet, and so make his announcement.”

original: Atha kho te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesu
translated: The wanderers fell silent.

original: Atha kho pañcakaṅgo thapati yena uggāhamāno paribbājako samaṇamuṇḍikāputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā uggāhamānena paribbājakena samaṇamuṇḍikāputtena saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho pañcakaṅgaḥ thapati yena uggāhamānaḥ paribbājakaḥ samaṇa muṇḍikā putto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā uggāhamānena paribbājakena samaṇa muṇḍikā puttena saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the householder Pañcakaṅga went to the wanderer Uggahamana, the son of Muṇḍiya, and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho pañcakaṅgaṁ thapatiṁ uggāhamāno paribbājako samaṇamuṇḍikāputto etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnam kho pañcakaṅgam thapatim uggāhamānaḥ paribbājakaḥ samaṇamuṇḍikāputtaḥ etat avoca
translated: After this exchange of friendly greetings and courtesies, he sat down to one side, and Uggahamana said to him:

original: “catūhi kho ahaṁ, gahapati, dhammehi samannāgataṁ purisapuggalaṁ paññapemi sampannakusalaṁ paramakusalaṁ uttamapattipattaṁ samaṇaṁ ayojjhaṁ.
analyzed: catūhi kho aha gahapati dhammehi samannāgatam purisa puggalam paññapemi sampanna kusalam parama kusalam uttama patti pattam samaṇam ayojjha
translated: “Householder, when a person has four qualities, I describe him as accomplished in what is wholesome, perfected in what is wholesome, attained to the supreme attainment, an ascetic invincible.

original: Katamehi catūhi?
analyzed: katamehi catūhi
translated: What are the four?

original: Idha, gahapati, na kāyena pāpakammaṁ karoti, na pāpakaṁ vācaṁ bhāsati, na pāpakaṁ saṅkappaṁ saṅkappeti, na pāpakaṁ ājīvaṁ ājīvati—
analyzed: idha gahapati na kāyena pāpa kammam karoti na pāpakam vācam bhāsati na pāpakam saṅkappam saṅkappeti na pāpakam ājīvam ājīvati
translated: Here someone does no evil bodily actions, does no evil verbal actions, does no evil mental actions, and does not earn his living by any evil means of livelihood.

original: imehi kho ahaṁ, gahapati, catūhi dhammehi samannāgataṁ purisapuggalaṁ paññapemi sampannakusalaṁ paramakusalaṁ uttamapattipattaṁ samaṇaṁ ayojjhan”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho aha gahapati catūhi dhammehi samannāgatam purisa puggalam paññapemi sampanna kusalam parama kusalam uttama patti pattam samaṇam a yojjhanti
translated: When a person possesses these four qualities, I describe him as accomplished in what is wholesome, perfected in what is wholesome, attained to the supreme attainment, an ascetic invincible.

original: Atha kho pañcakaṅgo thapati uggāhamānassa paribbājakassa samaṇamuṇḍikāputtassa bhāsitaṁ neva abhinandi nappaṭikkosi.
analyzed: atha kho pañcakaṅgaḥ thapati uggāhamānassa paribbājakassa samaṇamuṇḍikāputtassa bhāsitam na iva abhinandi na paṭikkosi
translated: Then the carpenter Pancakanga neither approved nor disapproved of the wanderer Uggahamana’s words.

original: Anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi:
analyzed: an abhinanditvā a paṭikkositvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: Without doing either he rose from his seat and went away, thinking:

original: “bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṁ ājānissāmī”ti.
analyzed: bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa attham ājānissāmi iti
translated: “I shall find out the meaning of this statement in the presence of the Blessed One.”

original: Atha kho pañcakaṅgo thapati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha khalu pañcakaṅgaḥ thapati yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Then the carpenter Pancakanga went to the Blessed One, and after paying homage to him, he sat down at one side

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho pañcakaṅgo thapati yāvatako ahosi uggāhamānena paribbājakena samaṇamuṇḍikāputtena saddhiṁ kathāsallāpo taṁ sabbaṁ bhagavato ārocesi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho pañcakaṅgaḥ thapati yāvatakaḥ ahosi uggāhamānena paribbājakena samaṇamuṇḍikāputtena saddhim kathā sallāpaḥ tam sabbam bhagavataḥ ārocesi
translated: and told him what had happened.

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhagavā pañcakaṅgaṁ thapatiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte bhagavā pañcakaṅgam thapatim etat avoca
translated: When he had finished, the Lord said:

original: “evaṁ sante kho, thapati, daharo kumāro mando uttānaseyyako sampannakusalo bhavissati
analyzed: evam sante kho thapati daharaḥ kumāraḥ mandaḥ uttānaseyyakaḥ sampanna kusalaḥ bhavissati
translated: “If that is so, then a young tender infant lying prone,

original: paramakusalo uttamapattipatto samaṇo ayojjho, yathā uggāhamānassa paribbājakassa
analyzed: parama kusalaḥ uttama patti patto samaṇaḥ ayojjhaḥ yathā uggāhamānassa paribbājakassa
translated: a supreme holy man, a perfected being, a sage, a yogin, a holy man, a brahmin,

original: samaṇamuṇḍikāputtassa vacanaṁ.🔽Daharassa hi, thapati, kumārassa mandassa uttānaseyyakassa kāyotipi na hoti, kuto pana kāyena pāpakammaṁ karissati, aññatra phanditamattā.
analyzed: samaṇamuṇḍikāputtassa  daharassa hi thapati kumārassa mandassa uttānaseyyakassa na hoti kutas pana kāyena pāpa kammam karissati aññatra phandita mattā
translated: as the wanderer Uggahamana, the son of Muṇḍiya, says.🔽For a young tender infant lying prone, a mere lump of corruption, has no thought of ‘I am’, how much less so of doing evil by body, speech or thought, except by reflex action.

original: Daharassa hi, thapati, kumārassa mandassa uttānaseyyakassa vācātipi na hoti, kuto pana pāpakaṁ vācaṁ bhāsissati, aññatra roditamattā.
analyzed: daharassa hi thapati kumārassa mandassa uttānaseyyakassa vācā atipi na hoti kutas pana pāpakam vācam bhāsissati aññatra rodita mattā
translated: For a young tender infant lying prone, a mere lump of corruption, has no thought of ‘I am’, how much less so of speaking evil, except by reflex action.

original: Daharassa hi, thapati, kumārassa mandassa uttānaseyyakassa saṅkappotipi na hoti, kuto pana pāpakaṁ saṅkappaṁ saṅkappissati, aññatra vikūjitamattā.
analyzed: daharassa hi thapati kumārassa mandassa uttānaseyyakassa saṅkappa utipi na hoti kutas pana pāpakam saṅkappam saṅkappissati aññatra vikūjita mattā
translated: For a young tender infant lying prone, Master, has no thought of ‘I will have such and such a thought,’ so how should he think a bad thought, except through mere habit?

original: Daharassa hi, thapati, kumārassa mandassa uttānaseyyakassa ājīvotipi na hoti, kuto pana pāpakaṁ ājīvaṁ ājīvissati, aññatra mātuthaññā.🔽Evaṁ sante kho, thapati, daharo kumāro mando uttānaseyyako sampannakusalo bhavissati
analyzed: daharassa hi thapati kumārassa mandassa uttānaseyyakassa na hoti kutas pana pāpakam ājīvam ājīvissati aññatra mātu thaññā  evam sante kho thapati daharaḥ kumāraḥ mandaḥ uttānaseyyakaḥ sampanna kusalaḥ bhavissati
translated: For a young tender infant lying prone, Master, has no livelihood, so how should he have a bad livelihood, except through mere habit?

original: paramakusalo uttamapattipatto samaṇo ayojjho, yathā uggāhamānassa paribbājakassa
analyzed: parama kusalaḥ uttama patti patto samaṇaḥ ayojjhaḥ yathā uggāhamānassa paribbājakassa
translated: If that is so, Master, then a young tender infant lying prone, Master, will be a perfected one, a great man, one of great wisdom, one who has attained to the highest success of a sage, a monk who has no more training to do,

analyzed: samaṇamuṇḍikāputtassa  catūhi kho aha thapati dhammehi samannāgatam purisa puggalam paññapemi na ca iva
translated: just as the wanderer Uggahamana claims that the monk Moggallana is.🔽But, Master, I declare that a person who possesses four qualities is not a perfected one, not a great man, not one of great wisdom, not one who has attained to the highest success of a sage, not a monk who has no more training to do,

original: sampannakusalaṁ na paramakusalaṁ na uttamapattipattaṁ samaṇaṁ ayojjhaṁ, api cimaṁ
analyzed: sampanna kusalam na parama kusalam na uttama patti pattam samaṇam ayojjha api cima

translated: and stands over the young tender infant, the helpless one, lying prone.

original: Katamehi catūhi?

translated: Here, Thapati, one does not do evil deeds by way of body, does not do evil deeds by way of speech, does not do evil deeds by way of thought, does not do evil deeds by way of livelihood.
